org.openpnp.spi

Interface Actuator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HeadMountable, Identifiable, Locatable, Movable, MovableMountable, Named, PropertySheetHolder, Solutions.Subject, WizardConfigurable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractActuator, HttpActuator, NeoDen4FeederActuator, ReferenceActuator, ScriptActuator, ThermistorToLinearSensorActuator

    public interface Actuator
extends HeadMountable, WizardConfigurable, PropertySheetHolder
    Defines a simple interface to some type of device that can be actuated on the machine or on a head. This is a minimal interface and it is expected that concrete implementations may have many other capabilities exposed in their specific implementations.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Actuator.ActuatorValueType 
      static interface  Actuator.InterlockMonitor
      The InterlockMonitor controls an actuator to perform an interlock functions in the course of machine motion.

    • Method Detail

      • getDriver

        Driver getDriver()
        Returns:
        the driver through which this Actuator is controlled.

      • setDriver

        void setDriver(Driver driver)

      • isDriverless

        default boolean isDriverless()
        Returns:
        true if a Driver is not required. Some actuator sub-classes use alternative means for actuation (http, scripting, etc).

      • getValueType

        Actuator.ActuatorValueType getValueType()
        Declares the primary value type of the Actuator. This will allow the GUI to present the proper control for value editing.
        Returns:

      • getProfileValues

        java.lang.String[] getProfileValues()
        In case the Actuator has the Profile value type, this will return the available choice of values.
        Returns:

        void actuate(java.lang.Object value)

      • getLastActuationValue

        java.lang.Object getLastActuationValue()
        Returns:
        the last actuation value or null if no actuation has happened since the last homing.

      • isActuated

        boolean isActuated()
        Returns the Boolean state of the actuator i.e. whether the last actuation was not equal to the default off value. Returns false when the actuator state is unknown, i.e. when it was never actuated.
        Returns:

      • read

        java.lang.String read()
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Read a value from the actuator. The value will be returned exactly as provided by the Actuator and can be interpreted as needed by the caller.
        Returns:
        The value read.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there was an error reading the actuator.
